description.narrative:
PDRRN, in collaboration with other CSO networks is building the Joint Humanitarian Appeals Network (temporarily named PONDO)whose main purpose is to accountably raise funds to address the needs of communities affected by disasters and deliver the most appropriate humanitarian assistance to where it is needed, and in ways that uplift the dignity of survivors of disasters and emergencies.
In line with this purpose, PDRRN will take the lead in facilitating the capacity building of the network on fund raising. The main activities will be: 1. organisational assessment for fund raising readiness 2. development of capacity building module for the network 3. fund raising skills building and planning workshop 4. analysis of workshop outputs and refinement of fund raising action plan
These activities will generate the final output - a fund raising action plan - that will be implemented by the network through a dedicated fund raising team.

PONDO is conceived to be a fund for Filipinos, by Filipinos during disasters. PONDO builds on the Filipinos' spirit of mutual aid (bayanihan) and capacity for resilience. PONDO specifically addresses the gap in financing humanitarian action. Public appeals for emergencies is not new, but this joint appeals platform is unique because it combines several features of public appeals that is led by national NGO networks and is appropriate to the Philippine context. It also commits to be transparent and accountable to the communities it will support as well as to the giving public, to set a benchmark on accountability for other organizations that are doing public fundraising for humanitarian actions.
